pyxtal_ml.descriptors.voronoi_descriptors module¶

class pyxtal_ml.descriptors.voronoi_descriptors.Voronoi_Descriptors(crystal)[source]¶

Bases: object

Computes crystal structure and composition features using Voronoi polyhedra

Parameters:crystal – A pymatgen crystal structure
crystal¶

A pymatgen crystal structure

comp; composition data of crystal
elements¶

the pymatgen element objects of the crystal constituents

polyhedra¶

the voronoi polyhedra corresponding to each site in the structure

shells¶

the shells to compute voronoi polyhedra over for chemical ordering parameters

Get_stats(array, weights=None)[source]¶

Compute the min, max, range, mean, and mean absolute deviation over a 1-d array

Parameters:
  • Array – a 1-d float array
  • weights – a numerical value to be used as a weight for the chemical environment attributes
Returns:

the stats described above
static MAD(array, weights=None)[source]¶

Compute the mean absolute deviation of a 1-d array

Parameters:
  • array – A 1-d array or list
  • weights – weights corresponding to each element of the array
Returns:

the weighted mean absolute deviation of the 1-d array
all()[source]¶

Computes all Voronoi polyhedra features

Calls all voronoi features and stacks them into a 1-d array

compute_polyhedra()[source]¶

Compute the voronoi polyhedron and specie of each atomic site, format as a tuple (polyhedron, specie), and store those tuples in a list as an attribute

static get_all_nearest_neighbors(method, crystal)[source]¶

Get the nearest neighbor list of a structure

Parameters:
  • method – method used to compute nearest_neighbors
  • crystal – pymatgen structure
Returns:

nearest neighbors
get_bond_statistics()[source]¶

Computes the mean bond length and bond length variance of the crystal using Voronoi polyhedra

Returns:see Get_stats
static get_chemical_descriptors_from_file(elm, weight)[source]¶

Calls certain elemental properties from the Elements.json file to use as weighted chemical environment attributes

Parameters:
  • elm – a pymatgen element object
  • weight – a numerical value to be used as a weight for these attributes
Returns:

an array of chemical environment attributes
static get_chemical_descriptors_from_pymatgen(elm, weight)[source]¶

Calls certain elemental properties from Pymatgen to use as weighted chemical environment attributes

Parameters:
  • elm – a pymatgen element object
  • weight – a numerical value to be used as a weight for these attributes
Returns:

an array of chemical environment attributes
get_chemical_ordering_parameters()[source]¶

Computes the mean chemical ordering parameter and chemical ordering parameter variance for all elements in the crystal using Voronoi polyhedra

Returns:[mean coordination number, coordination number variance]
get_descr(elm, weight)[source]¶

Calls chemical attributes from pymatgen and a json file

Parameters:
  • elm – a pymatgen element object
  • weight – a numerical value to be used as a weight for these attributes
Returns:

an array of weighted chemical envronment attributes
get_effective_coordination_number()[source]¶

Computes the mean coordination number and coordination number variance for all elements in the crystal using Voronoi polyhedra

Returns:see Get_stats
get_environment_attributes()[source]¶

Computes some statistics of selected elemental properties using voronoi polyhedra

These statistics include: mean, standard deviation, min, max, and range

Returns:a list of property statistics in the crystal
get_packing_efficiency()[source]¶

Computes the packing efficiency of the crystal using Voronoi polyhedra

Returns:[packing efficiency]
get_volume_statistics()[source]¶

Computes the mean volume of all Voronoi polyhedra in the structure

Returns:[volume_variance / mean_volume]
populate_element_dict()[source]¶

For features that depend on elements, populate a dictionary of empty lists with each element in the structure as a key

Parameters:elements_list – a list of pymatgen element objects
Returns:an dictionary of empty lists where the keys are pymatgen elements
static weighted_average(array, weights=None)[source]¶

Compute the weighted average of a 1-d array

Parameters:
  • array – a 1-d array or list
  • weights – weights corresponding to each element in the list
Returns:

the weighted average of the array
